Could you also add the action to the docs at https://github.com/openbmc/phosphor-fan-presence/blob/master/docs/control/events.md#actions
this for loop could probably go into its own function, returning an optional.
what if you just used the group's name as the key?  then you wouldn't have to worry about putting the right index into the config file.

Hi, this action allows more than one group to be configured but uses only one maximum value of all for further processing. In case more than one group is configured, I wonder if we should use the name of the first group to be the key, or separate each group with their name and use their own maximum value for their own processing (the groups still share the same table in "map", and the result from the two ways will be the same though). I think we should still use "index".

What if you just increased a static index counter during the construction of the action instance?

That way if you have two instances of this action configured, you'll automatically get indices 0 and 1?
Yours is way better than mine, thank you for your suggestion.
could you get to a point here where groupSpeed was still zero?  If so, then it would be possible that all elements in _speedFromGroupsMap are zero and you'd end up trying to set the target to zero.

This only does setTarget() when the group value changes and passes the hysteresis check, and the algorithm covers all cases of the mapping table I think. Moreover, if the group value exceeds the lower border in the table, it will use the corresponding lower border target value for groupSpeed (which might not be zero). So I think it won't end up setting zero to _speedFromGroupsMap. Please help point out if I really made a mistake here. 
Btw, I forgot to set _prevGroupValue to new groupValue, which makes _prevGroupValue stay 0, but it still runs mistakenly properly, I will correct this.

Hi, it is the case when both current and prev value of the group reside between level A and level B in the mapping table, but the step between A and B is larger than the hysteresis param so it still passes the hysteresis check.

Example:
hysteresis = 2

value:           target:
-------------------------------
10            |  50
15            |  55
16            |  60 
...           |  ...
-------------------------------

prev group value: 11, current group value: 14

My code has not covered this, so groupSpeed stays zero. The reason I did this is it's rare when any step between levels is larger than the hysteresis, when we already specify hysteresis as the minimum difference to process further. Technically, groupSpeed can only be 0 at the end because of this case. 
As "target" should stay unchanged in this case, following the table, I will initialize groupSpeed with _speedFromGroupsMap[_groupIndex], instead of 0. That way, it will take the old speed value when it does not fall to any condition check (groupSpeed is not updated). Or do you think I should check if(groupSpeed!=0) to asign _speedFromGroupsMap[_groupIndex] = groupSpeed at the end?
you can add your own company name here (and may as well update the year too)
I think wrapping on the next few lines is off.
these member variables can all be private.
you can just use size_t for this, there isn't really a reason to limit it to a uint16.  In fact, maybe change groupIndex also to a size_t below.
yeah I agree with you, I wasn't aware
nit: a few trailing spaces on a few of the lines here.
period instead a comma I think would be better here.
maybe just had a blurb here to say how that the static map will be shared across different instances of the action?  Just to make it obvious on how the action could be configured.
I don't get this one much, please confirm if what you mean is that I should not clarify how the static map is implemented, and should just focus on depicting how this action can be configured?
Was just suggesting it mentions that the map is shared across instances, which is what you added, so I'm good.
Thank you a lot for your kind review.
nit: can you change these tabs to spaces?
nit: this paragraph has strange wrapping
Could you add the "Tested" phase in the commit message?
I think the commit message describes kinda well what the zone is about, also in the document. So adding "Tested" will make it too long.
nit: no need for the semicolon here
I referred the one from set_parameter_from_group_max.cpp. Done
Looks good!  One more thing before merging - I finally merged a commit to add meson build support to the repo, so could you rebase on latest master and then add the file into the control/meson.build?
yeah of cause, done! Thank you Matt.
There are something not right during my test today, I need to check again.
I guess you may just need to rebase this on master so it doesn't show this file as an add?
I already rebased before modifying. I think it's only showing my 'json/actions/target_from_group_max.cpp' line adding. Do you mean something else by this?
Does anyone from your team need to review this?
Verified with Mt.Jade automatic FAN control
